00041 /** @brief A chessboard widget that is synchronized with a \link cwchess::ChessPosition ChessPosition \endlink.
00042 * 
00043  * This is the object that you want to use (instead of ChessboardWidget).
00044 * 
00045  * It combines cwmm::ChessboardWidget with cwchess::ChessPosition,
00046  * keeping the position on both synchronized.
00047 * 
00048  * Apart from the reimplemented ChessPosition methods listed above, every other method
00049  * of both base classes are public <em>except</em>:
00050 * 
00051  * - ChessboardWidget::set_square : Use \link ChessPositionWidget::place place \endlink instead.
00052  * - ChessboardWidget::get_square : Use \link cwchess::ChessPosition::piece_at piece_at \endlink instead.
00053  * - ChessboardWidget::set_active_turn_indicator : Use \link ChessPositionWidget::to_move(cwchess::Color const&) to_move \endlink instead.
00054  * - ChessboardWidget::get_active_turn_indicator : Use \link cwchess::ChessPosition::to_move() to_move \endlink instead.
00055 * 
00056  * This object has three builtin modes:
00057  * - Position setup (see #mode_edit_position).
00058  * - Game play (see #mode_edit_game).
00059  * - Disable widget (see #mode_disabled).
00060 * 
00061  * In game play mode, the user can only pick up pieces of the color
00062  * that is to move, and only do legal moves (illegal moves cause
00063  * the piece to be put back where it came from).
00064 * 
00065  * In position setup mode, the user can move pieces arbitrarily around
00066  * and use a right-click popup menu to select and place new pieces
00067  * on the board, clear a square, select which color is to move,
00068  * copy and paste to/from the clipboard, swap colors, clear the
00069  * board, set up the initial position, mark a pawn as being allowed
00070  * to taken en passant and mark rooks or kings has having moved.
00071 * 
00072  * Finally, the 'disable widget' mode just means that the user is
00073  * not allowed to pick up or place pieces. This would be the typical
00074  * state to put the widget in while the user is waiting for the
00075  * opponent to move.
00076 * 
00077  * In order to allow a flexible interaction with the widget, the
00078  * following signals and events are provided:
00079 * 
00080  * - Mouse leaves the chessboard (see #on_cursor_left_chessboard).
00081  * - Mouse enters a (different) square (see #on_cursor_entered_square).
00082  * - A mouse button was pressed (see #on_button_press).
00083  * - A mouse button was released (see #on_button_release).
00084  * - A piece was picked up (see \link ChessPositionWidget::signal_picked_up signal_picked_up \endlink).
00085  * - A piece was dropped (see \link ChessPositionWidget::signal_dropped signal_dropped \endlink).
00086  * - A (legal) move was executed (see \link ChessPositionWidget::signal_moved signal_moved \endlink).
00087  * - An illegal move was attempted (see \link ChessPositionWidget::signal_illegal signal_illegal \endlink).
00088 * /
00089 class ChessPositionWidget : protected cwchess::ChessPosition, public cwmm::ChessboardWidget {
00090   public:
00091   /** @name Get/Set Widget Modes* /
00092   //@{
00093 
00094     //! The type of the builtin widget modes.
00095     typedef unsigned int widget_mode_type;
00096     //! The value used for the 'Edit Position' mode.
00097     static widget_mode_type const mode_edit_position = 0;
00098     //! The value used for the 'Edit Game' mode.
00099     static widget_mode_type const mode_edit_game = 1;
00100     //! The value used for the 'Widget disabled' mode.
00101     static widget_mode_type const mode_disabled = 2;
00102 
00103     //! Return the current widget mode.
00104     widget_mode_type get_widget_mode(void) const { return M_widget_mode; }
00105     //! Set the widget mode.
00106     void set_widget_mode(widget_mode_type widget_mode) { M_widget_mode = widget_mode; }
00107 
00108   //@}
00109 
00110   private:
00111     //! The current widget mode.
00112     widget_mode_type M_widget_mode;
00113     //! The signal generator for 'piece pick up' events.
00114     sigc::signal<void, cwchess::Index const&, cwchess::ChessPosition const&> M_signal_picked_up;
00115     //! The signal generator for 'piece drop' events.
00116     sigc::signal<void, gint, gint, cwchess::ChessPosition const&> M_signal_dropped;
00117     //! The handle of the floating piece under the mouse pointer, if any.
00118     gint M_floating_piece_handle;
00119     //! Temporary storage for copied positions.
00120     Glib::ustring M_clipboard_content;
00121     //! Set when trying primrary clipboard contents.
00122     bool M_trying_primary;
00123 
00124   /** @name 'Edit Game' mode related variables* /
00125   //@{
00126 
00127     //! The square that a piece was picked up from.
00128     cwchess::Index M_move_from;
00129     //! The object used to promote pawns.
00130     Glib::RefPtr<cwchess::Promotion> M_promotion;
00131     //! The signal generator for legal moves.
00132     sigc::signal<void, cwchess::Move const&, cwchess::ChessPosition const&, cwchess::ChessPosition const&> M_signal_moved;
00133     //! The signal generator for illegal moves.
00134     sigc::signal<void, cwchess::Move const&, cwchess::ChessPosition const&> M_signal_illegal;
00135 
00136   //@}

00144     //! A pointer to a drawable used for it's colormap (for the icons in the popup menu).

00170   /** @name Constructor* /

00173     /** @brief Constructor.
00174     * 
00175      * @param drawable : A drawable, usually the main window of the application.
00176      * @param promotion : An object derived from Promotion that handles pawn promotions.
00177     * /
00178     ChessPositionWidget(Gtk::Window* drawable, Glib::RefPtr<cwchess::Promotion> promotion = Glib::RefPtr<cwchess::Promotion>(new cwchess::Promotion)) :
00179         M_floating_piece_handle(-1), M_widget_mode(mode_edit_position), M_promotion(promotion), M_MenuPopup(NULL), M_drawable(drawable), M_trying_primary(false)
00180     {
00181       // Continue initialization when realized.
00182       drawable->signal_realize().connect(sigc::mem_fun(this,& ChessPositionWidget::initialize_menus));
00183     }
00184

00247   /** @name ChessPostion methods : Position setup
00248   * 
00249    * For a description of these methods, see the member functions
00250    * with the same name in cwchess::ChessPosition.
00251   * /
00252   //@{
00253     
00254     using ChessPosition::set_half_move_clock;
00255     using ChessPosition::set_full_move_number;
00256     using ChessPosition::set_has_moved;
00257     using ChessPosition::clear_has_moved;
00258 
00259     //! See cwchess::ChessPosition::clear.
00260     void clear(void) { ChessPosition::clear(); sync(); }
00261     //! See cwchess::ChessPosition::initial_position.
00262     void initial_position(void) { ChessPosition::initial_position(); sync(); }
00263     //! See cwchess::ChessPosition::skip_move.
00264     bool skip_move(void) { bool result = ChessPosition::skip_move(); set_active_turn_indicator(to_move().is_white()); return result; }
00265     //! See cwchess::ChessPosition::to_move.
00266     void to_move(cwchess::Color const& color) { ChessPosition::to_move(color); set_active_turn_indicator(to_move().is_white()); }
00267     //! See cwchess::ChessPosition::set_en_passant.
00268     bool set_en_passant(cwchess::Index const& index) { ChessPosition::set_en_passant(index); set_active_turn_indicator(to_move().is_white()); }
00269     //! See cwchess::ChessPosition::swap_colors.
00270     void swap_colors(void) { ChessPosition::swap_colors(); sync(); }
00271     //! See cwchess::ChessPosition::place.
00272     bool place(cwchess::Code const& code, cwchess::Index const& index) { if (ChessPosition::place(code, index)) set_square(index.col(), index.row(), code); }
00273     //! See cwchess::ChessPosition::load_FEN.
00274     bool load_FEN(std::string const& FEN);
00275 
00276   //@}

00506 
00507   /** @name Events* /
00508   //@{
00509 
00510     /** @brief Called when a mouse button is pressed while the mouse is on the chessboard.
00511     * 
00512      * @param col : The column of the square the mouse is on.
00513      * @param row : The row of the square the mouse is on.
00514      * @param event : The button press event.
00515     * 
00516      * Useful members of the event are:
00517      * - <code>event->button</code> : The number of the button that is pressed.
00518      * - <code>event->type</code> : <code>GDK_BUTTON_PRESS</code> for a normal click, <code>GDK_2BUTTON_PRESS</code> for a double click.
00519      * - <code>event->x</code>, <code>event->y</code> : The exact pixel coordinates where was clicked.
00520     * 
00521      * The default does nothing but return false.
00522     * 
00523      * This function should normally return false. If it returns true then
00524      * the event is considered to be completely handled and nothing else
00525      * will be done.
00526     * 
00527      * In case of a double click, this function is called three times.
00528      * First with <code>event->type == GDK_BUTTON_PRESS</code>, followed by a call to #on_button_release.
00529      * Next again with <code>event->type == GDK_BUTTON_PRESS</code> and then with <code>event->type == GDK_2BUTTON_PRESS</code>.
00530      * Finally #on_button_release will be called a second time. Therefore, a call to this
00531      * function with <code>event->type == GDK_BUTTON_PRESS</code> and a subsequent on_button_release at
00532      * the same coordinates should be a non-operation (if you want to use double clicks too).
00533     * /
00534     virtual bool on_button_press(gint col, gint row, GdkEventButton const* event) { return false; }
00535 
00536     /** @brief Called when a mouse button is released.
00537     * 
00538      * @param col : The column of the square the mouse is on, or -1 if the mouse is outside the chessboard.
00539      * @param row : The row of the square the mouse is on, or -1 if the mouse is outside the chessboard.
00540      * @param event : The button release event.
00541     * 
00542      * Useful members of the event are:
00543      * - <code>event->button</code> : The number of the button that is released.
00544      * - <code>event->x</code>, <code>event->y</code> : The exact pixel coordinates where it is released.
00545     * 
00546      * The default does nothing but return false.
00547     * 
00548      * This function should normally return false. If it returns true then
00549      * the event is considered to be completely handled and nothing else
00550      * will be done.
00551     * /
00552     virtual bool on_button_release(gint col, gint row, GdkEventButton const* event) { return false; }
00553 
00554     /** @brief Called when the mouse pointer left the chessboard.
00555     * 
00556      * The default does nothing.
00557     * /
00558     virtual void on_cursor_left_chessboard(gint prev_col, gint prev_row) { }
00559 
00560     /** @brief Called when the mouse pointer entered a new square.
00561     * 
00562      * The default does nothing.
00563     * /
00564     virtual void on_cursor_entered_square(gint prev_col, gint prev_row, gint col, gint row) { }
00565 
00566   //@}
00567 
00568   /** @name Signals* /
00569   //@{
00570 
00571     /** @brief Return handler for events signaling that the user picked up a piece.
00572     * 
00573      * This signal is generated whenever the user picks up a piece.
00574      * It can happen in both 'Position Setup' as well as 'Game Play' mode.
00575     * 
00576      * Note that a double-click on a piece will cause the piece to be picked
00577      * up and dropped, then picked up again, then the double click event
00578      * will be generated and upon final release of the mouse button the
00579      * piece will be dropped again. You have to take into account that this
00580      * happens when dealing with double clicks.
00581     * /
00582     sigc::signal<void, cwchess::Index const&, cwchess::ChessPosition const&>& signal_picked_up(void) { return M_signal_picked_up; }
00583 
00584     /** @brief Return handler for events signaling that the user dropped a piece.
00585     * 
00586      * This signal is generated whenever the mouse button is released after
00587      * picking up a piece.
00588     * /
00589     sigc::signal<void, gint, gint, cwchess::ChessPosition const&>& signal_dropped(void) { return M_signal_dropped; }
00590 
00591     /** @brief Return handler for events signaling that the user did a (legal) chess move.
00592     * 
00593      * This signal is only generated while the widget is in 'Game Play' mode.
00594      * If the user picks up a piece and drops it on a different square and
00595      * this is a legal move, then the move is executed (the ChessPosition is updated)
00596      * after which this signal is generated.
00597     * 
00598      * Be aware that callback functions should return promptly or the GUI would freeze.
00599      * If, for example, you want the computer to play the other color then the
00600      * callback function would merely put the widget in 'Disabled' mode, set
00601      * a flag that it is the turn of the computer and return immediately.
00602      * In general, calculating a reply move would be done in a seperate thread.
00603     * /
00604     sigc::signal<void, cwchess::Move const&, cwchess::ChessPosition const&, cwchess::ChessPosition const&>& signal_moved(void) { return M_signal_moved; }
00605 
00606     /** @brief Return handler for events signaling that the user attempted an illegal move.
00607     * 
00608      * This signal is only generated while the widget is in 'Game Play' mode.
00609      * Note that dropping a piece on the square where it was picked up, or
00610      * dropping it outside the board is <em>not</em> an illegal move, but
00611      * is considered to be an abort of 'pick up and move' action.
00612     * /
00613     sigc::signal<void, cwchess::Move const&, cwchess::ChessPosition const&>& signal_illegal(void) { return M_signal_illegal; }
00614 
00615   //@}
00616 
00617   protected_notdocumented:
00618     virtual bool on_button_press_event(GdkEventButton* event);
00619     virtual bool on_button_release_event(GdkEventButton* event);
00620 
00621   private:
00622     void sync(void);
00623 };
00624 
00625 } // namespace cwmm
00626 
00627 #endif  // CHESSPOSITIONWIDGET_H
